Sentece: Cirrhotic patients had a greater plasma bevantolol half-life (6.9 +/- 4.0 hr, mean +/- SD) then did patients with normal liver function (2.8 +/- 1.1 hr, P less than .01), and they also had a longer duration of significant bevantolol-induced heart rate slowing (for 12 hours after oral dose in cirrhotics versus three hours for controls).
Title: Bevantolol disposition in patients with hepatic cirrhosis.
Name: Bevantolol

Sentece: After intravenous (i.v.) administration of 50 mg of the drug, there was a biexponential decline in plasma levels with a terminal elimination half life (t1/2) of 1.9 h (range 1.4-2.3 h) and a total apparent volume of distribution at equilibrium of 62 L.
